titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Hill, Indictment
CWG6819

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Kentucky Cumberland Circuit Court
Th April Term 1865
The following orders was made to wit
Comth of Kentucky Plff
vs } Indictment for selling whiskey to soldiers
John Hill Defendant

This day came the Defendant as well as the attorney for the Commonwealth and on his motion and by the consent of the attorney for the commonwealth, Confessed himself indebted to the commonwealth of Kentucky in the Sum of Ten dollars, it is therefore ordered and adjudged by the court that the plaintiff recover of the Said Defendant the Sum of ten dollars and the cost about this prossecution expended and he may be Taken

a copy att. J. M. Boles clk
Kentucky

Same Plff
v } Indictment for selling to Soldiers
A. N. English Deft

This day came the Defendant as well as the commonwealth by attorney, and on motion of Defendant and by consent of the commonwealth by attorney the Defendant confessed himself indebted to the Commonwealth in the Sum of Ten dollars, it is therefore ordered and adjudged by the court that Plff recover of Deft the Sum of Ten Dollars and the costs of this prossecution and he may be taken
a copy att. J. M. Boles clk

Same Plaintiff
vs } Indictment for selling to Soldiers
Charles Hill Deft

This day came the Defendant as well as the Commonwealth by attorney, and on motion of Defendant and by consent of the Commonwealth by attorney the Defendant acknowledged himself indebted to the Commonwealth of Kentucky in the Sum of Ten dollars, it is therfore ordered and adjudged by the court that the Plaintiff recover of the Defendant the Sum of Ten dollars and the costs about this prossecution expended and he may be Taken
a copy att. J, M, Boles clk

Same Plaintiff
vs } Indictment for selling whiskey To Soldiers
W, O, Hill Deft

This day came the defendant as well as the Commonwealth by attorney, and on motion of the Defendant by Consent of the attorney for the Commonwealth Said Defendant confessed himself indebted to the Said Commonwealth in the Sum of Ten dolllars. It is therefore orderd and adjudged by the court that the Plaintiff recover of the Defendant the Sum of Ten dollars with Costs of prosecution and he may be taken
a copy att. J. M. Boles clk
